item.title: 3b1b Lec1: The simpler quadratic formula
item.description: My notes from 3blue1brown #1 lecture. What is it? This lecture is about deriving the quadratic formula in a more intuitive matter. For those of you who don't remember, the quadratic formula is the formula \[ r, s = \frac{-b \pm \sqrt{b²-4ac}}{2a}.\] Here \(r\) and \(s\) is the roots of the function \(f(x) = ax² + bx + c\). The roots \(r\) and \(s\) represents where on the \(x\) axis \(f(x) = 0.

item.title: Sampling
item.description: I think it make sense to start with sampling, as this takes the signal from the analog domain to the digital domain.
